page.title: 04St. Laurence Church
page.content: St. Laurence's Church at Sigglesthorne was built in the{13th {Century.}It has been extended and restored many times over the years. In 1973 (12 years ago) some lead was stolen from the church roof,then again in 1976 and again in 1982.So now they have a stainless-steel roof. The church itself is worth over Â£450,000 including a 100 year old {organ}worth Â£63,000,and the{East {Window}worth Â£5,000, and not including its land. The church has a small{bell tower with three bells. The church has three flags which are flown from the tower. The records about the{Rectors}go back to the date 1200 when Hugh de Melsa was Rector. The Restoration Fund was started by Sir William Bethal and Arch Deacon Bentinck.
